prompt:
Is the person who wrote this in the wrong in the following situation?

"""
AITA for throwing an unwanted party?
So next week is my best friend's birthday and i decided to throw him a surprise party. Everyone was excited and everything was cool untill today.

We talked today just us 2, and i asked him what he is doing for his bday, he said that if said that hes glad theres no party and if there was one he would be mad af. (The party is at his house so hes just gonna be extra mad)

He said he hates birthday parties many times before but i thought he was just saying that so hr won't be dissapointed if theres no party.

Ive been planning this party for a long time and its way too late to cancel. 

AITA for not listening to him and doing whatever i want?
"""

Is the author in the wrong? Answer A for Yes (the author is in the wrong) and B for No (the author is not in the wrong). Answer nothing else.

thinking.text:
Okay, let's see. The person is asking if they're in the wrong for throwing a surprise party for their best friend when the friend clearly didn't want it. The friend said he hates parties and didn't want one, but the person didn't take it seriously, thinking maybe he just didn't want to disappoint them. Now they're stuck with planning it and can't cancel.

Hmm. So, first, the friend had expressed dislike for birthday parties before. The author might have known this but ignored it. Even when the friend directly said he would be mad if there was a party, the author still went ahead. That's a problem. The party is at his house, so the friend is in a tough spot. The author didn't listen to clear signals. Even if the friend had said he was okay with it, the author still went against his wishes. Planning a party is a big commitment, but if the person it's for doesn't want it, it's not right. The answer is probably A. They should have respected the friend's wishes instead of assuming he was lying. Surprise parties can be nice, but when the person doesn't want them, it's inconsiderate. The author is in the wrong.
